Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<PlayerMessage>
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observer<PlayerMessage>
This class purpose is to implement the logic that allows a match to run. The actions performed are based on player commands, received through the notify method of the player's virtualView. Once a command is verified to be legal, methods of the class Model are called, to update the game status

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Controller​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players, java.util.ArrayList<ServerSideConnection> connections)
    creates model, passing the number of players creates one virtualView for each player every virtualView is added as model's observer, and controller is added as observer for every virtualView colours are assigned to the players a card selection message is sent to to the first player

    • model

      private final Model model

    • virtualViews

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players, java.util.ArrayList<ServerSideConnection> connections)
      creates model, passing the number of players creates one virtualView for each player every virtualView is added as model's observer, and controller is added as observer for every virtualView colours are assigned to the players a card selection message is sent to to the first player
      Parameters:
      players - is the list of players in the game
      connections - is the list that contains the Connection objects associated to each player

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update​(PlayerMessage message)
      Invokes one of Controller's methods based on the message's subclass
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<PlayerMessage>
      Parameters:
      message - PlayerMessage is the message containing the action the player wants to perform

    • performMove

      private void performMove​(PlayerMovementChoice message)
      makes sure the player who sent the command is allowed to move, if not, an error message is notified. The same thing happens if the player is allowed to move but the move is not permitted If the player cannot move, he is eliminated from the match, and this could cause his/her opponent to win After a successful move, the win condition is verified. If true, the match ends. If the player didn't win, the next step in the turn is notified to him/her
      Parameters:
      message - contains the data regarding the which worker to move and where

    • performBuild

      private void performBuild​(PlayerBuildChoice message)
      makes sure the player who sent the command is allowed to move, if not, an error message is notified. The same thing happens if the player is allowed to build but the action is not permitted If the player cannot build, he is eliminated from the match, and this could cause his/her opponent to win After a successful build, The next step in the turn is the notified to him/her
      Parameters:
      message - contains the data regarding the which worker to build with and where to build

    • endTurn

      private void endTurn​(PlayerEndOfTurnChoice message)
      Checks that the player can end is turn, if not, an error message is notified Updates the turn
      Parameters:
      message - represent the player's will to end his/her turn

    • quitGame

      private void quitGame​(PlayerQuitChoice message)
      checks if the player is eliminated, only in that case he is allowed to quit Removes the player from the game. It causes the player to disconnect and the observer objects to detach
      Parameters:
      message - represent the player's will to quit from the game

    • cardSelection

      private void cardSelection​(PlayerCardChoice message)
      This methods is responsible for the cards' selection. It calls the model's methods responsible for the selection of the correct card from the game deck, then the selected card is assigned to the player. After a card has been chosen, a selection request is sent to the next player. The last Player's card is assigned automatically. In the end, the starting position request is sent to the youngest player
      Parameters:
      message - contains the card chosen by the player

    • positionSelection

      private void positionSelection​(PlayerStartingPositionChoice message)
      Checks if the position can be selected, in that case the model is updated and a new request is sent to the next player. In the opposite case, an error message is notified and a new request is sent.
      Parameters:
      message - contains the starting position of the player's two workers

    • getPlayers

      private java.util.ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()
      This method uses the VirtualView list to get the players in the match
      Returns:
      the list of players in the match

    • getColoursAssignedString

      private java.lang.String getColoursAssignedString()
      Returns:
      a string which tells the player-color association

    • assignLastCard

      private void assignLastCard()
      This method is used by the CardSelection method to assign the last card to the last player, and to send the first starting position request

    • declaration

      private void declaration()
      creates a string which groups the descriptions of the GodCards used in the game

    • endGame

      private void endGame()
      detaches all the observers left, because the match has ended.

    • getModel

      public Model getModel()

    • getVirtualViews

      public java.util.ArrayList<VirtualView> getVirtualViews()
